dish_description: The dish is a simple spaghetti recipe for two, featuring a sauce made with anchovies, garlic, jalapeno pepper, parmesan cheese, and olive oil, finished with parsley.

cooking_steps.description: Cook half a pound of spaghetti in boiling water until it reaches the desired doneness, typically between 11 to 15 minutes.
Extend the pasta in the boiling water to ensure it melts evenly.
Prepare the sauce by adding oil from a container of anchovies into a bowl.
Chop the anchovies and crush three cloves of garlic, then combine them with the oil.
Slice half of a jalapeno pepper and add it to the sauce mixture.
Incorporate a couple of tablespoons of parmesan cheese and two tablespoons of olive oil into the sauce.
Heat the sauce in the microwave for about one to one and a half minutes to cook the garlic.

Drain the cooked pasta, reserving half a cup of the pasta water. Combine the pasta with the heated sauce, adding the reserved pasta water if needed to adjust consistency. Garnish with parsley, additional cheese, and a dash of olive oil before serving.
